shake somebody/something ↔ up.translatio: to give someone a very unpleasant shock, so that they feel very upset and frightened
She was badly shaken up by the accident.
to make changes to an organization in order to make it more effective
the government’s plans to shake up the educational system
to make changes in an organization or system to make it more successful, effective etc
They restructured organizations and introduced competition, to shake up monopolies perceived as inefficient and complacent.
